intro: Oedina erecta, commonly known as the upright spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and is native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its small, clustered flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces a milky sap that can be toxic. Oedina erecta is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
